intro: Septemeranthus, commonly known as the seven-flower plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and features showy, often fragrant flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce berries as their fruit. Septemeranthus species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Their botanical characteristics make them valuable in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
